channel.title: +Egypt on Vishvas's notes
channel.description: Recent content in +Egypt on Vishvas's notes

item.title: Antiquity
item.description: Intro “To fathom how long these have stood, Cleopatra is closer to u& me by 1000 yrs than she was to earliest Pharaoh’s” Greek recognition Plato in Timaeus “He replied:-In the Egyptian Delta, at the head of which the river Nile divides, there is a certain district which is called the district of Sais, and the great city of the district is also called Sais, and is the city from which King Amasis came.

item.title: Ethnicity
item.description: Depictions seated scribe 2600BCE heminunu great pyramid architect 2600BCE Old images . Note the contrasting depictions applied to Tutankhamen. [Fayum portraits are burials of middle class Egyptians from Cleopatra’s era. DNA studies TW]. “There have been quite a few DNA studies on modern Egyptians, and to date, no noticeable amount of DNA from Italy or Greece has been detected, or DNA from anyone other than Arab, Berber and African.

item.title: Temple ritual
item.description: Sanctuary design “The concept of a main sanctuary for a main deity of a temple with subsidiary sanctuaries for other deities with the main sanctuary being a small, dark chamber & daily rites being done to it at morning, mid-day & evening — paralleling the गर्भगृह-परिवार-नित्यार्चन model of आगम-s. Note that the Egyptian temple is a microcosmic image of creation, with innermost sanctuary of the temple representing the primeval island which emerged out of the primordial ocean & creation of life begun.
